criteria: Identifying and Describing Violence Prevention Strategies
Application of Refusal Skills in Risky Scenarios
Understanding the Dangers of Gang Involvement
Communication Skills for Avoiding Risky Situations
descriptions: Student does not identify any violence prevention strategies.
Student identifies at least one violence prevention strategy, but the description is unclear or inaccurate.
Student identifies one violence prevention strategy and provides a basic description.
Student identifies two violence prevention strategies and provides a clear description for each.
Student identifies three violence prevention strategies and provides a detailed description for each, demonstrating good understanding.
Student identifies multiple violence prevention strategies and provides a comprehensive and nuanced description for each, demonstrating excellent understanding.
Student does not demonstrate any application of refusal skills.
Student attempts to apply refusal skills, but the approach is inappropriate or ineffective.
Student applies refusal skills in a limited manner, with some effectiveness.
Student consistently applies refusal skills in relevant scenarios, demonstrating moderate effectiveness.
Student confidently applies refusal skills in various scenarios, demonstrating high effectiveness and adaptability.
Student skillfully and strategically applies refusal skills in complex scenarios, demonstrating exceptional effectiveness and nuanced understanding of social dynamics.
Student demonstrates no understanding of the dangers of gang involvement.
Student shows minimal awareness of the dangers of gang involvement, with significant misconceptions.
Student identifies at least one danger of gang involvement, but the explanation is superficial.
Student identifies several dangers of gang involvement and provides a basic explanation for each.
Student identifies and explains the dangers of gang involvement in detail, demonstrating good comprehension of the potential consequences.
Student provides a comprehensive and insightful analysis of the dangers of gang involvement, demonstrating excellent understanding and awareness of the complex factors involved.
Student demonstrates no communication skills related to avoiding risky situations.
Student attempts to communicate, but the approach is unclear, passive, or aggressive.
Student uses basic communication skills to attempt to avoid risky situations, with limited effectiveness.
Student employs clear and assertive communication skills in relevant scenarios, demonstrating moderate effectiveness.
Student confidently and effectively communicates in various risky situations, demonstrating high adaptability.
Student skillfully and strategically uses nuanced communication techniques to navigate complex or high-pressure situations, demonstrating exceptional adaptability.
